  • list_item – item to check
Returns:

Return type:

excelaccess.utils.excel_utils.is_old_excel_format(excel_file_path)[source]¶

Simple check for Excel format by file ending.

Parameters:excel_file_path (str) – a (relative) path to an Excel file
Returns:True if is old, False if not and None if none of them applies
Return type:Boolean or None
excelaccess.utils.excel_utils.parse_cell_idx(cell_str)[source]¶

Parses Excel indices to int. (not ‘zero indexed’, standard Excel index range)

Parameters:cell_str (str) – cell in Excel notation
Returns:(row, column)
Return type:(int, int)
excelaccess.utils.excel_utils.parse_cell_idx_zero(cell_str)[source]¶

Uses above parse function and shifts indices by 1. (‘zero indexed’)

Parameters:cell_str (str) – cell in Excel notation
Returns:(row - 1, column - 1)
Return type:(int, int)

excelaccess.utils.general_functions.get_dict_key_for_name(name)[source]¶

Simply returns the provided string as lowercase string. (in order to have a centralized convention)

Parameters:name (str) – name string
Returns:name string lowercase

excelaccess.utils.general_functions.local_packages(site_packages_paths=None, logging_level=None)[source]¶

Adds given paths to sys.path in order to provide imports of packages from other directories. Could also be moved outside a function to be directly executed on import

Parameters:
  • site_packages_paths (str or list(str)) – (relative) path(s) to site-package(s)
  • logging_level – logging level to be used, defaults to logging.NOTSET
excelaccess.utils.general_functions.recursive_print(src, dpth=1, key=None)[source]¶

Recursively prints nested elements.

excelaccess.utils.unorderd_tree module¶

@author: uidq3472

class excelaccess.utils.unorderd_tree.RootNode(col_offset=0, row_offset=0)[source]¶

Bases: excelaccess.utils.unorderd_tree.TreeNode

Inherited class of TreeNode. Its purpose is only too provide an empty base root. That is needed because of flat header hierarchies.

Parameters:
  • col_offset (int) – absolute column offset if table does not start at 0 in Excel
  • row_offset (int) – absolute row offset if table does not start at 0 in Excel
class excelaccess.utils.unorderd_tree.TreeNode(title, parent=None, row_index=0, col_index=0, col_offset=0, row_offset=0)[source]¶

Base class for a node in a tree-like structure.

Parameters:
  • title (str) – header field
  • parent (TreeNode or None) – parent element if there is one
  • row_index (int) – row index of this field for better determination and for indexing of data
  • col_index (int) – column index of this field for better determination and for indexing of data
  • col_offset (int) – absolute column offset if table does not start at 0 in Excel
  • row_offset (int) – absolute row offset if table does not start at 0 in Excel
add_child(child)[source]¶

Adds a child to the calling node.

Parameters:child (TreeNode) – a child node to be added
